intro: Malanea sarmentosa f. tomentosa, commonly known as the hairy malanea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy, glandular leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist environments. Its unique morphology and ornamental value make it a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture.
